text: chatham I met on our way to Afghanistan
it was my second deployment to
Afghanistan Ramona's first we were at
manas air base in Kyrgyzstan and it was
my job to push everyone through to
Afghanistan make sure the transition was
smooth I was sitting in the back of the
room and I noticed her and it flashed
through my head I was like I'm gonna
marry this woman I stopped myself right
away and I'm like what do you mean
you're going to marry this woman that's
crazy you know what I mean so we
actually flew down to Bagram together we
were on the same flight and then we you
know ended up at our final destination
in jallalabad together we were sitting
on top of our duffel bags waiting for
our c-130 and she asked me if I wanted
any craisins and she told me she said
they were they were good for my prostate
when I first met him I definitely
thought it was cute you know I sort of
wondered about him you know like I
wonder if he's married I wonder if he
has a girlfriend but it was still you
know there were so many other things
going on if you had told me that I was
going to meet the one in Afghanistan I
would have laughed in your face I
thought how can you even get to know
someone when you know what we're talking
about with general order number one you
can't have any physical contact with a
member of the opposite sex you can't be
in the same room as them if it's just
the two of you like and you know like
your be hut where you where you spend
the night where you sleep and everything
so there was to me it was totally
unfeasible obviously there's no physical
interaction you know I was it was
against the rules we would go on walks
whenever we could steal a moment it was
the day after my birthday and people my
friends had made a big deal about my
birthday you know we're down range in
Afghanistan let's do something on
Saturdays there was always a bizarre
that you know the local Afghans brought
their rugs and
they're semi precious stones and
everything and so I was walking back
from lunch and Chad you know stopped me
and he asked if I wanted to go down to
the bazaar with him so you know we took
our weapons and you know walked across
the airfield it was you know 140 degrees
outside it was just your sweltering heat
and that was our first date you know we
went on our post deployment block leave
so for 30 days we came back home we were
in the States when we got back it was
like okay now we're real people in real
life in civilization we can we can do
real things we can go out to dinner we
can go shopping we can sit on the couch
together and watch television we can do
laundry you know we got to know each
other as real people and not just people
in the Army before I knew it I was
deploying again I didn't want to go into
plumbing without let her know how I
truly felt about her he proposed to me
right before just a few days before I
flew to Afghanistan I thought was
perfect opportunity we walked up to the
top of the hill we live in a town called
Park Stein and it's a basalt kegel they
say in German and all the way on the top
is a little chapel so we walked up there
and Chad proposed you know you can see
this gorgeous 360 panoramic view of the
countryside so it was it was meaningful
and it was it was great and I said yes
right away
